The Debugging property page is used to define the debugging options for your project to be used at runtime.
2 Actions
The actionpropertiesare user-specific properties and will not be applied to the project as a whole, but saved in a separate user configuration file. Theses user specific settings do not require a project recompilation to reflect their changes.
Start Application
Ifyour project isrequires a client application to function correctly, such in the case of a Class Library project,then you will need to specify a client application to use when debugging. Note: Please ensure that the output of the project is the same assembly that the client application will be using when it is run.
Start Application Path
The Start Applications Path is used to change the working directory of the client application that uses the projects compiled assembly.
Arguments
The Arguments property allows you to specify any required command line arguments for either the selected project or, if a Start Application is defined, the Start Application.
2 Generate Debug Info
Generate Debug Info
This property tells the compiler whether or not to generate the debugging information needed by the debugger to debug your project. It is recommended that this option is set to true for all debugging related configurations, and set to false for any release related configurations. If this property is set to false you will be unable to debug the code for the selected project. For precompile library project the debugging information is always generated.
